questions.text: How early did Diane want to leave work?
questions.explanation:
10 minutes.

	I wonder how Diane actually held on her job since she was always coming in late or leaving early. This time Diane asked to leave 10 minutes early two weeks from that coming week. She told Sam that she was leaving to go on a date. Sam told her to have fun, but she took it as he was upset by it because he still liked her.

questions.correct: tickets for the Sox-Yankee double header
options: tickets for the Sox-Yankee double header
questions.explanation:
tickets for the Sox-Yankee double header.

	Norm did a man's taxes and as a result he was given sky view seats for the Sox-Yankees double header. The others were jealous of him, Sam said he could only get standing room only tickets.

options: Tanning booth plus a place that grooms dogs
A place where you work with leather and wash your clothes
A place where they groom dogs and work with leather.
questions.explanation:
Tanning booth with a laundromat.

	Norm had invested in the Tan 'N' Wash but did not want to let his friends invest. He was afraid that if something went wrong, they'd all blame him.

questions.text: How many shares did Cliff want?
questions.explanation:
5.

	Sam also said he wanted five. Carla and Diane each wanted one share. Woody did not want to get in.

questions.text: What color skin did Diane say she had?
questions.explanation:
alabaster.

	Carla commented on how white Diane was. She said Diane needed to use the Tan 'N' Wash not just invest in it.

questions.text: How had the world treated Norm?
questions.correct: Like a baby treats a diaper
questions.explanation:
Like a baby treats a diaper.

	The others were getting on Norm because the Tan 'n' Wash started off so slowly. He told them to be patient but they would not be patient.

Frasier.

	Norm told him he's supposed to start off slowly in the tanning booth that way burning wouldn't happen. Carla slaps Frasier on the back and asks him "What was your reaction the first time you saw Diane naked?" Frasier screams because of the pain of the sunburn.

questions.text: What did Carla say about Tan 'N' Wash?
questions.explanation:
"Tan 'N' Wash bites it!".

	The weather for the upcoming week was supposed to be warm and sunny. As a result everyone wanted out of Tan 'N' Wash.

questions.text: Did it snow in this episode?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	Everyone then got upset with Norm because they were not making money and he was. Norm, frustrated with how he was treated, decided to leave Cheers.

questions.text: Did Norm leave Cheers in the end?
questions.explanation:
no.

	He was going to put the talked him out of leaving. Diane said that they weren't really mad at him, they were mad that they weren't making money because they didn't stick with Tan 'N' Wash. He then informed them that he never sold their shares so they all made money too. But then Tan 'N' Wash roof collapsed because of the snow and the place wasn't insured. When Norm told the others they threw snowballs at him.
